column1: #Text=such is our weakness , that we often more readily believe and speak of another that which is evil than that which is good .
#Text=But perfect men do not easily give credit to every report ; because they know man 's weakness , which is very prone to evil , and very subject to fail in words .

#Text=All through that evening , and through the first part of the succeeding day , I was crowded out of the curate 's mind by a host of thoughts with which I had nothing in common ; and though I hovered about him as he taught in the school , and visited several sick people , and argued with an habitual drunkard , and worked at his Sunday sermon , a Power , which I felt but did not understand , baffled all my attempts to gain an entrance and attract his notice .
#Text=I made a desperate attack on him after lunch as he sat smoking and enjoying a well-earned rest , but it was of no avail .

#Text=I followed him to a large garden-party later on , but to my great annoyance he went about talking to every one in the pleasantest way imaginable , though I perceived that he was longing to play tennis instead .
#Text=Mr. Blackthorne was talking to the lady of the house , Mrs. Courtenay , when she suddenly exclaimed : --
#Text=" Ah , here is Mr. Zaluski just arriving .

#Text=Zaluski greeted the curate pleasantly , and his dark eyes lighted up with a gleam of amusement .

#Text= Oh , we are great friends , " he said laughingly .
